pr_title: create accountId amazon client provider and use it in the load balancer integration

timeline.message: create accountId amazon client provider and use it in the load balancer integration

timeline.bodyText: Is it ok to create many of those during initialization if there are concurrent calls?
timeline.author: tbak

replies.bodyText: 👍 probably not a huge deal, it might just increase the number of thread (pools) and connections during initialization a bit, but I agree it would be probably better to do a simple double-checked lock of the whole thing here and serialize calls
replies.author: fabiokung

timeline.bodyText: Is it an invariant that account id is always set in the load balancer id?
timeline.author: tbak

replies.bodyText: yes, a valid ARN must always contain the accountId and Arn.fromString(loadBalancerId) does the validation.
replies.author: corindwyer

timeline.bodyText: Looks like we are using string representation arn.toString() returned by this function. Do we need to build Arn object or would we rather build a string and return just that?
timeline.author: joshi-keyur

replies.bodyText: I am using the ARN builder in order for it to provide validations and guarantee what is outputted is a valid ARN.
replies.author: corindwyer

timeline.bodyText: How do we make sure the credentials provider in the Map is still valid and has not expired the session duration when first constructed?
timeline.author: joshi-keyur

replies.bodyText: The STSAssumeRoleSessionCredentialsProvider has a background thread that does the automatic refreshing.
replies.author: corindwyer
